page.title: 08PLACE NAMES in Withington 1
page.content: As a rural, chiefly agricultural area place names on 1985 o.s. maps have their origins in words from the language known as Old English (O.E.) dating back to the 5th & 6th cent. Some have much earlier Celtic origins. These words were used to identify a place by describing some geographical, topographical or other feature, and through the centuries have evolved into very different forms. In the Lower Withington area are :_ {Withington}from O.E. widign tun "willow farm".{Whisterfield}O.E. hwit stan esfeld "open land near a white stone" maybe a boundary stone, as the place is on a township boundary. The name evolved as Quitstanisfeld (1260) Wistanisfeld (1301) Whystonsfeld (1400).{Siddington Heath}O.E. sudan tun (place) south of the hill.{Windy {Harbour}O.E. windighere beorg "windy
